channel.title: Books by Reese Gerjekian
channel.description: Recent content on Books by Reese Gerjekian

item.description: “Through the lens of growth, our spoken truths may persist or falter, implying that the choice of silence can be a profound beacon, preventing misguided influence.” Reese Gerjekian (1/24/2024) “Love between us can break the wall history built, even if it never goes away.” Reese Gerjekian (1/27/2024) “Don’t let the worries of time hinder your soul” Reese Gerjekian (2/22/2024) “The hatred of others fuels my thoughts of hate, and I hate that” Reese Gerjekian (3/1/2024) “Maybe it’s not something you missed, but rather something that has yet to be found” Reese Gerjekian (3/12/2024) “There’s a place between good and bad, a state of nothingness that holds everything” Reese Gerjekian (3/13/2024) “Some see beauty in everything and, in times of sorrow, carry the burden for those who don’t.

“Hope to find peace in your work, or you’ll continue to work for your peace” Reese Gerjekian (1/25/23) “It will go if you let it” Reese Gerjekian (3/8/23) “A life of certain peace is never found due to the curiosity of others” Reese Gerjekian (3/17/23) “Sometimes what you want is not what is right” Reese Gerjekian (3/17/23) “Life’s too pretty to be upset by it” Reese Gerjekian (3/19/23) “Life will run its course whether you let it or not, so just let it” Reese Gerjekian (3/28/23) “Beautiful things are going to come and go, but cherishing them when they do come and long after they go is what will build a strong and loving mindset” Reese Gerjekian (4/18/23) “You should grow in retrospect.

“You should grow to love your fears” Reese Gerjekian (01/13/22) “Care about what’s necessary, but remember there’s nothing you can do change anything except for your own thoughts, perspectives and actions” Reese Gerjekian (1/31/22) “Time is only limited when you tell yourself it is” Reese Gerjekian (2/8/22) “It’s hard to live a simple life when you’re constantly reaching for the stars” Reese Gerjekian (2/11/22) “Always be mindful but never let it hinder your happiness.

“Patience enables us to hold onto our desires” Reese Gerjekian (1/5/2021) “I like to say I do nothing because I’m always doing something different” Reese Gerjekian (1/5/2021) “One things for certain in this world, we know nothing” Reese Gerjekian (1/10/2021) “A world full of desire leads to war, a world full of war leads to ruin, a world full of ruin leads to desire” Reese Gerjekian (1/10/2021) “Whose to say your opinions wrong but yourself” Reese Gerjekian (1/14/2021) “People sometimes choose to love you for who you are or just for what they see” Reese Gerjekian (1/20/2021) “I’m not selfish for my personal gain, I feel major altruism in me” Reese Gerjekian (1/31/2021) “If you think you’re a winner over others, you’re already losing” Reese Gerjekian (2/8/2021) “Depression is just thoughts of the past, Anxiety is just thoughts of the future.

“Information about oneself is most powerful when you’re the only one who possesses it“ Reese Gerjekian (07/01/2020) “Life is only as good as the way you perceive it.” Reese Gerjekian (07/12/2020) “Sometimes the good/bad things are better left unnoticed” Reese Gerjekian (07/13/2020) “The greatest thing about the puzzle is the pieces, without the pieces, there’s no puzzle” Reese Gerjekian (07/24/2020) “Life is a series of quests. every quest gets you closer to your desired goal” Reese Gerjekian (08/01/2020) “The good raise bad and the bad raise good” Reese Gerjekian(09/28/2020) “The one thing in life that never changes is the fact that it never stops changing” Reese Gerjekian (10/20/2020) “The quiet rarely speak because they enjoy listening” Reese Gerjekian (11/25/2020) “Your ability depends on your focus” Reese Gerjekian (12/5/2020) “Never let age or status deceive you” Reese Gerjekian (12/9/2020) “The lack of ones listening deteriorates trust and communication with another” Reese Gerjekian (12/9/2020) “Even when your sight is blurred, your vision can be clear” Reese Gerjekian (12/21/2020) “The toughest part about love is trying to put it into words” Reese Gerjekian (12/31/2020)
